main event: A pilot in an F-86 aircraft spotted an unidentified orange light in the sky while flying over Tennessee in 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as being round, comparable in size to a star, and orange in color.
The object was observed moving in a straight and level course from east to west.
The pilot attempted to chase the object but was unable to close in on it due to its excessive speed.
The sighting was observed both visually and on airborne radar.
Several attempts were made to identify the object, including contacting nearby air traffic control, weather stations, and military bases, but no conclusive explanation was found.
